segments.title: Defining Density Concept
segments.summary: Explains density as the ratio of mass to volume, with standard units of kg/m³. Describes density as a measure of how packed or crowded something is, using examples of water and iron.

segments.title: Air Density Variation
segments.summary: Explains how air density varies with altitude due to atmospheric pressure. Lower layers have higher density due to the weight of air above compressing molecules together.

segments.title: Density and Floating
segments.summary: Demonstrates how objects with lower density float while those with higher density sink, using examples of oil and water, iron bolt, and ice.

segments.title: Water Density Temperature Relationship
segments.summary: Explains how water's density changes with temperature, reaching maximum density at 4°C. Describes the unique behavior of water density below 4°C.

segments.title: Water Density Characteristics
segments.summary: Discusses how water's density remains constant with depth, unlike air, because liquids are incompressible. Even under extreme ocean pressures, water density stays uniform.
